She graduated from Pasadena Memorial in 2011 and currently serves patients as a registered nurse in the Intensive care unit at Memorial Hermann Southeast Hospital. Guzman has spent the past two months caring for critically ill covid-19 patients who are on ventilators or life support because they are unable to maintain their own airway.

When asked about her experience on the frontlines, she said, "The hardest part about it all is watching it all happen before your eyes from the nurse sidelines. The best thing is seeing the patient overcome it and being able to see the small light at the end of the tunnel."

Christal has been working tirelessly to provide the best medical care to patients, along with the emotional and physical support they need to get through this situation.

She said she knows that at the end of the day, we are all human and we are in this together.

Help us recognize this covid-19 frontline hero.

#HeartsforHeroes

A message from Superintendent, Dr. DeeAnn Powell:

Pasadena ISD Family,

As I sit at my desk typing this, I am reminded of how difficult this pandemic has been for so many of us. This is usually a very busy time of year when I would personally attend as many award ceremonies, end-of-the-year banquets and fun celebrations that I possibly could fit into my calendar. I miss our students and our staff and no matter how busy I stay, I find myself thinking about the laughs, the hugs and the recognitions of achievement that we are all missing. One thing I refuse to give up is our plan to celebrate our Class of 2020. Please know we are moving forward with our plan to celebrate our seniors in July in whatever safe and permissible format that is allowed at that time.

Pasadena ISD Class of 2020, we are so proud of you for staying focused and staying strong throughout this pandemic. We decided to do something special to recognize our resilient senior class. We have created customized Facebook frames for each high school for our students, proud parents and community members to upload to their Facebook profile so everyone across the district and the Houston area can see our PRIDE in the Pasadena ISD graduating seniors. Please click this link to view the instructions to upload the Class of 2020 frame through Facebook. https://www1.pasadenaisd.org/departments/departments_c-_e/communications/social_media/facebook_frames

As we approach the end of the year, I want to inform you that Summer School this year will be virtual and information will be provided by each campus. Kindergarten through fourth grade will focus on small groups of children who have gaps in their reading and math skills. Students enrolled in Personalized Learning in grades 4-12 will complete focus areas and projects, while grades 5-12 will continue current course work and recovering failing grades from the first semester. Initial credit will also be offered for high school students. Registration information will be provided by campuses next week.

Looking ahead, we will be offering full-day Pre-K online registration for the 2020-2021 school year starting next week. Information will be posted on our district website. I ask each of you to check our district website and social media outlets for updates on a regular basis. Campus social media is also a great way to stay informed regarding information specific to your child‚Äôs campus.

I know there are many questions about returning library books, devices and other items at this time. Guidance about handling the safe return of these items and all end-of-the-year procedures and plans for the summer have been developed by each campus and these plans will be shared very soon.

In closing, I just want to encourage everyone to FINISH STRONG! We will continue to keep you updated through social media, district and campus website and phone calls.

Take care and stay safe,

DeeAnn Powell

Williams Elementary School music teacher Barbara Birkhead has a very unique mission that she shares with her students. Out of 76 Texas schools, six in Pasadena ISD earned the CREST (Counselors Reinforcing Excellence for Students in Texas) award! This award recognizes schools across the state that demonstrate a commitment to students by providing them with classroom guidance, college and career readiness skills, along with social/emotional skills.

The winning schools and guidance counselors are:

- Burnett Elementary: Leticia Sanchez
- AB Freeman Elementary: Ilsa Garza
- Fred Roberts Middle School: Emily Ontiveras and Deronda Pitra
- Lonnie B. Keller Middle School: Shari Harris and Tracy Skripka
- Meador Elementary PISD: Tara Merida
- Rick Schneider Middle School (PISD): Danielle Knight and Santana Fairley

For more information, click here: https://www1.pasadenaisd.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=80772&pageId=36340375&action=design
